column1: During the height of the pandemic response the National Guard mobilized to help communities around the country tackle COVID-19. I helped spearhead the effort to ensure our National Guard had the support they needed to accomplish their important work. https://t.co/pFN2EJUTNU

Doctors are warning of another potential COVID-19 surge. This pandemic is not going to magically disappear. For months the American people have been waiting on this Administration to lead us out of this crisis. @JoeBiden will do that and much more - he’ll #BuildBackBetter.

This past week I met with voters in Peoria. One topic that came up was how small businesses are fairing in this challenging time. COVID-19 relief and recovery is not over it's important we keep small business owners and frontline workers top of mind. https://t.co/U9ffNuqYQW

Washington Republicans have completely failed in their response to the COVID-19 pandemic and American families cannot afford their reckless agenda to fully dismantle the ACA.  Democrats are the party of health care. #ProtectOurCare

It’s devastating to see the increase of cases and hospitalization due to COVID-19 in my home county and across #IL17. Together we can help defeat this pandemic - remember to wear a mask wherever you go and stay home if you feel sick! https://t.co/CKRz8Ss493

Just like the President Mike Pence failed to take COVID-19 seriously. @KamalaHarris would never callously risk American lives. Along with @JoeBiden Kamala will do all she can to end this pandemic and get our country back on track.

As Vice President @JoeBiden helped build back our economy alongside President Obama. There is no one better equipped to #BuildBackBetter to revive our country and our economy from the devastation of COVID-19.
Trump played COVID down. He made a pandemic worse and played political games that resulted in 204000+ lives lost. We need a President that has a plan to put #COVID behind us.
While I highly recommend voters vote by mail this year I know many people still wish to vote in person. How will polling places stay safe in the COVID era? https://t.co/B49niMByYa

A heartfelt thank you and a round of applause to essential workers in Rock Island and across #IL17. Our communities would have been hard pressed to stay safe and to keep moving forward during COVID-19 without the dedication of essential workers. https://t.co/4i5a03MwqL

The Food Stamp Act was enacted to make sure that Americans experiencing poverty are able to feed themselves and their families. The COVID-19 crisis has put into sharp focus the importance of such laws. Nearly 7 million Americans have applied for SNAP benefits since February.

.@KamalaHarris is right Donald Trump has failed. The seriousness of COVID-19 was brushed aside for distractions while American lives and livelihoods came screeching to a halt. Our working families deserve better. Watch Kamala's remarks below: https://t.co/gTsml4kHfk

This Administration continues to fail communities that have traditionally been left behind like rural America and our communities of color. The COVID-19 crisis has laid these issues bare.  We need an experienced leader to tackle COVID-19. With @JoeBiden we can #BuildBackBetter.

Wearing a mask is a sign of respect for each other and will help us stop the spread of COVID-19. Show your support the 2020 way by grabbing one of my Cheri Bustos masks! https://t.co/GK3gEqdYAp https://t.co/oEZjo0SFiP

@tedlieu @ClyburnSC06 @dccc Lastly COVID-19 has had an enormous effect on us all -- but especially our teachers farmers unions and frontline heroes. We must do everything we can to ease the burden for hardworking families -- that's why I fought for the CARES Act and continue to fight for the HEROES Act.

@tedlieu @ClyburnSC06 @dccc And earlier this year House Democrats passed the #FamiliesFirst Act to extend paid sick leave and unemployment benefits while making COVID-19 testing available for all. This virus doesn't discriminate and neither should our health care.

@dccc @CatherineForNV @TomPerez @dscc @DNC The COVID-19 pandemic has created a dilemma for many Americans -- that's why we're fighting for four pillars of voting rights to protect us all as we vote in November.

Wearing a mask helps stop the spread of COVID-19 and saves lives. Each of us can do our part to protect ourselves and others. Wear a mask stay home when necessary and get tested to help keep those around you healthy and safe. https://t.co/YIDukAMpnc

Now there’s a simpler way to see how COVID-19 cases are rising across the state. Stay safe and healthy by wearing a face mask washing your hands and staying up-to-date with how COVID-19 is changing in your area. https://t.co/35xtjjEldF

COVID-19 has thrown a wrench into our economy. I am committed to rebuilding an economy that works for all of Illinois’ working and middle class families. Our communities must remain the best places possible to live and work.  https://t.co/hg9Bin0TBA https://t.co/bR3sFw1qXV

Washington Republicans have an obligation to condemn the president’s decision to slow down our nation’s response to this virus.  Saving lives should not be a partisan issue → COVID-19 has killed nearly 120000 Americans.

President Trump admitted to slowing down our government’s response to COVID-19. Every day Washington Republicans are silent about Trump’s decision they recklessly put politics ahead of the health and safety of the constituents they swore to protect.

By putting his personal politics over the health & safety of the American people President Trump put innocent lives at risk. Washington Republicans must condemn the president’s remarks and his failed COVID-19 response.

President Trump bragged about slowing down the COVID-19 testing we need to stop the spread of this pandemic and save lives. He did this because he feared the political consequences of Americans knowing how far the virus had spread across the United States under his watch.

I always look forward to the Congressional Women's Softball Game which raises money for @YSCBuzz. Unfortunately COVID-19 has disrupted the funds this game brings in. For many charities this is a new reality. Learn more about the Young Survival Coalition: https://t.co/bcP9JydJHU https://t.co/Rm8mh7mZHq

Every American should be able to #VoteByMail -- especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.  That’s why I’m calling on all states to take these four critical steps to ensure everyone can exercise their constitutional right to vote. 👇 https://t.co/I2ZNJZrXRy

Almost a quarter of our workforce has filed for unemployment during the COVID-19 pandemic and the numbers will likely continue to rise. We must ensure that jobless Americans have access to quality affordable health care. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/X8HBTf5xPx

The reality is that we do not know exactly how long this pandemic will last. I called for an extension of the COVID-19 National Guard Response because we need our brave service members on the front lines during this public health crisis. https://t.co/cE3nZOXpfm

The COVID-19 pandemic has resulted in 38 million people filing for unemployment. Access to quality affordable health care for jobless Americans is more important than ever -- we cannot let these folks go uninsured in the midst of a public health crisis. https://t.co/kcMiQxn0MQ

Our rural communities must be prioritized during the COVID-19 pandemic. I’m fighting to ensure that folks across the Heartland from our health care providers to our family farmers can access the resources they need to endure these tough times. #IL17 https://t.co/ktxzgWcXPu

The COVID-19 pandemic is taking a devastating toll on folks across the Heartland. Ramping up our testing capacity will be imperative for us to #FlattenTheCurve and slow the spread of this virus. #IL17 https://t.co/vstHxfy8UE

UPDATE: After the @dccc @TheDemocrats and @scdp filed a lawsuit in South Carolina lawmakers passed legislation to allow voters to request an absentee mail-in ballot due to the COVID-19 public health crisis.   This marks a major victory for voting rights in the Palmetto State. https://t.co/BZW2AeJdfq

Contact tracing will prove critical to slow the spread of COVID-19 and reopen our economy. We owe a debt of gratitude to the public health experts who are on the front lines tracking data to keep our communities safe. #IL17 https://t.co/tJzSFJSK2t

📺 WATCH: I joined @agripulse to discuss how the COVID-19 pandemic is impacting our rural communities. We must ensure that our family farmers and small businesses have the resources they need to overcome the fallout of this public health crisis. https://t.co/ZgvGb6IQcG

We must expand testing and contact tracing to #FlattenTheCurve. In Peoria we have set a strong example for how our COVID-19 response should be executed on a national level. #IL17 https://t.co/xU5Azm5E66

#VoteByMail is the safest way for Americans to cast their ballots during the COVID-19 pandemic. I believe all states should adopt no-excuse vote by mail and early voting for 20 days before elections. https://t.co/NrKgk16ZIL

Our rural communities must remain top-of-mind during the COVID-19 pandemic and beyond. I’m working day in and day out to ensure that folks across the Heartland can access the federal financial resources they need to endure this public health crisis. #IL17 https://t.co/SKq7hvLq2Y

Our postal workers put their lives at risk to provide essential services as we battle the COVID-19 pandemic -- that includes delivering mail-in ballots.  We must save this institution and do everything we can to protect our democracy in the process. https://t.co/xKXlbO43dr

The COVID-19 pandemic has exacerbated the disparity in broadband access especially for Americans living in rural parts of the country.   We must prioritize large-scale investment in rural broadband so that our communities can stay connected. https://t.co/53v4hGYpfe

COVID-19 has taken a toll on small businesses across America’s Heartland. I’m fighting to ensure that my #IL17 constituents have every resource at their disposal to help endure these volatile economic times.
The COVID-19 pandemic has fundamentally changed the way we need to approach our elections -- ensuring a safe and easy process for every voter to make their voice heard should have widespread support.

The COVID-19 pandemic presents unique challenges for our rural communities. Medical centers across the Heartland must have the tools and resources needed to meet this moment and provide Americans with quality treatment. https://t.co/RMk3UW8q7F

One thing we must get right before reopening the American economy is our COVID-19 testing capacity. Equipping frontline workers across the Heartland with ample testing kits will prove critical to flattening the curve.  https://t.co/9PD3cDcB5A

Testing. Testing. Testing.  The COVID-19 pandemic will not slow down unless America has a robust testing system -- we must ensure that hospitals frontline workers and every American have access to testing kits immediately. https://t.co/XxF44YeMHM

The COVID-19 pandemic has forced our family farmers to endure serious economic instability. We must ensure that small-business owners across the Heartland have the support they need to keep feeding our country.  I promise to never leave farmers behind.  https://t.co/9BPzrxktY7

The COVID-19 pandemic raises serious challenges for voters and poll workers and the @dccc will keep fighting to ensure South Carolinians can safely and freely participate in our democracy during this time of uncertainty: https://t.co/fsroZoqZAI https://t.co/gqLBTSA5js

The bipartisan coronavirus relief legislation that I helped pass puts America’s workers and #FamiliesFirst. These are unprecedented economic times and we must move forward in a way that is bold and values our way of life in the Heartland.

We must listen to public health experts and base our decision-making on science and data. Ramping up our country’s testing capabilities will prove critical to stopping the spread of COVID-19. It’s a necessary step on the path to re-opening our economy.

With the COVID-19 pandemic changing so much about how our campaigns and elections operate we cannot let election security fall by the wayside. Securing our free and fair elections and protecting our democracy must continue to be a priority. https://t.co/hHY6RtbchL
As we confront the challenge of COVID-19 elected officials should be doing everything possible to ensure our elections are both fair and safe.   The integrity of our democracy depends on it.

The @dccc joined @thedemocrats @NVDems and @PrioritiesUSA to file a lawsuit seeking to expand voting access for Nevada’s primary. The suit is being brought on behalf of Nevadans whose right to vote is being infringed under the current policies in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/MIMgx2VP03

House Democrats are looking at next steps to help hospitals farmers and small-businesses during the COVID-19 pandemic.  These are unprecedented times and I'll keep fighting to ensure every American has what they need to weather this crisis. https://t.co/HWNlG6VCj4
I’m calling on the CDC to collect nationwide data on how COVID-19 is attacking African American communities. It’s critical for this information to be publicly available. https://t.co/QkO1cPmP7s

As we fight this COVID-19 outbreak we cannot let it strip Americans of the one right that protects all others: the right to vote.  Every state must implement critical steps to ensure voters can safely make their voices heard. We can protect our health as well as our democracy. https://t.co/llwYKHEfTu

Illinois hospitals must be equipped with ample COVID-19 testing kits. The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act ensures free testing for anyone who needs it -- now let’s make sure those tests actually make it into the hands of our health care workers. https://t.co/sclcmk5pbV

Democrats are fighting to make it safer and easier for Americans to vote during the COVID-19 pandemic. I’m calling on all states to adopt no-excuse vote by mail and early voting for 20 days before elections because we must protect our democracy. https://t.co/gmbfvgVXz3

The bipartisan coronavirus relief package that I helped pass includes much-needed relief for our family farmers -- but we must do more. I’ll do everything in my power to ensure that our rural communities make it through this pandemic. https://t.co/4dTukDvF1J

My mother is 86 years old and there have been attempts to make her a victim of scams. We must protect our seniors during the COVID-19 pandemic and be on the lookout for those trying to take advantage of these difficult circumstances. https://t.co/0JLa7X6f5h

Health centers across our region will receive $4.5 million to combat the COVID-19 pandemic.  We must take care of those who are taking care of us. This funding will provide our health care workers with the tools they need to treat others and stay safe. https://t.co/whAbNs3c3I

I helped secure $4.9M in grants to support our community’s response to COVID-19. This money should immediately help folks and businesses stuck suffering amid this public health crisis.  You better believe I’ll always put my #IL17 constituents first. https://t.co/xlpYzSUVgm

🎙️ LISTEN: I joined @crisiscastpod to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic and our health care infrastructure’s ability to treat Americans across the country. It is imperative that we listen to and trust the experts during this public health crisis. https://t.co/HmTBbyiGzG

Rural communities face unique challenges when it comes to squashing the COVID-19 pandemic and their needs must be prioritized. I’ll keep fighting to ensure rural health centers have the tools and resources they need to combat this crisis. https://t.co/BtSzdCdf5M

From the COVID-19 pandemic to severe weather patterns farmers across the Heartland are understandably concerned about what lies ahead.   That’s why I voted for the coronavirus relief package that will ensure our family farmers have the aid they deserve. https://t.co/EUDI6QUhqK

I voted for the bipartisan relief package to ensure the financial security and well-being of American workers during this COVID-19 pandemic.  There’s no time to waste when it comes to helping them and their families navigate these difficult times. https://t.co/YUn902Sp4L

Health care workers are on the front lines battling COVID-19 -- they not only deserve our gratitude they deserve every resource available to help them safely treat their patients. https://t.co/kyWABNYWe2

The COVID-19 pandemic led a record-breaking 3.3 million people to file for unemployment last week. Fortunately our bipartisan coronavirus relief package will protect America’s workers and help provide some peace of mind for folks across the Heartland. https://t.co/NvPzfUHzYH

We need to keep rural communities in the conversation when it comes to dealing with the COVID-19 pandemic. I will keep fighting to ensure every community across the Heartland has the resources necessary to fight this public health crisis. https://t.co/ckEKvUSeNQ

In November Americans will vote in the most important election of their lives. We must prioritize election security especially as campaigns shift how they interact and connect with voters during the COVID-19 pandemic.  House Democrats will fight to protect our democracy.

Democrats are working together to make it easier and safer for folks to vote during the COVID-19 pandemic -- Americans should not be forced to put their health at risk in order to exercise their constitutional right to vote. https://t.co/AVaTlxrwux

It’s critical that our community health centers have the resources to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. I helped secure over $330K in grants for health centers across our region and I'll continue fighting to ensure #IL17 families are healthy & safe. https://t.co/r85H0swrZ0

Hi folks I just voted to pass a bipartisan relief package to ensure small businesses & American workers are taken care of during the COVID-19 pandemic. This workers-first bill builds on top of the action that our Democratic House Majority has already taken to put #FamiliesFirst. https://t.co/MTqt1lgNx9

I’m calling on all states to adopt no-excuse vote by mail and early voting for 20 days before elections amid the COVID-19 pandemic. We must ensure Americans don’t lose their chance to make their voices heard.  Nothing less than the health and future of our democracy is at stake. https://t.co/cnjC3S0E4j

Expanded COVID-19 testing will prove critical to curbing this pandemic. The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act provides free testing for anyone who needs it and will help health care workers treat patients across the Heartland. https://t.co/vYicSxGsEQ

We cannot let the COVID-19 pandemic strip Americans of the one right that protects all others: the right to vote.   The @dccc will continue to fight voter suppression wherever it exists. https://t.co/FZVrQ8p50U

.@GovPritzker’s stay-at-home order for all of Illinois is an important step that will help #StoptheSpread of COVID-19.   By each doing our part and working together our state will combat this pandemic. https://t.co/G8ZPI2SV6c

America’s health care workers are on the frontlines battling this pandemic and they have courageously risen to the occasion in this trying time.  I'll do everything in my power to equip them with the resources they need to treat patients across the country affected by COVID-19.
As we fight this COVID-19 outbreak with all we have we cannot let it strip Americans of the one right that protects all others: the right to vote. https://t.co/56xWvuofLs

Today I'm proud to join @TomPerez @AlexPadilla4CA @CatherineForNV @maura_healey @EllenRosenblum and @ericgarcetti in calling on states to adopt no-excuse vote by mail & early voting for 20 days before elections amid the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/wqI5v8lC22

Our Democratic House Majority boldly took action to keep Americans healthy & safe. Now we are hard at work to advance our third #FamiliesFirst coronavirus response package an economic stimulus proposal that will protect our nation’s workers and their financial security. https://t.co/FZzxfc4iA7

I remain in close communication with our first responders & medical professionals to ensure these folks know they have my full support in keeping our communities healthy & safe as they fight on the frontlines of the COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/WfSXw9OETE

The United States currently faces a severe blood shortage that the COVID-19 outbreak will only worsen further. If you're eligible please visit https://t.co/563I2u86fp or https://t.co/HgsytPguaK to learn more about how you can #GiveLife in the Quad Cities. https://t.co/HuFtlTNi1h

With the COVID-19 pandemic changing how our campaigns connect with voters and plan for elections it’s crucial that we continue to take election security seriously.  This is not a partisan issue. When it comes to securing our elections we can’t take our eyes off the ball.

Folks must follow every medical protocol to ensure we prevent COVID-19 from spreading further than it is already going to.  Our senior citizens and Americans with compromised immune systems are the most at risk and we must continue to do everything in our power to protect them.

Rural hospitals across the Heartland must be equipped with ample COVID-19 testing kits. Our #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act will make this a reality and remove the cost burden that families have feared as this pandemic spreads. https://t.co/JLeN1LBYG6

Our bipartisan #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act has been signed into law. As we work to combat the spreading COVID-19 pandemic House Democrats will continue fighting to support American families -- we’ll get through this together. https://t.co/KYrSmN380e

About 90000 kids in #IL17 receive free or reduced-cost lunches in school. The COVID-19 pandemic could now leave students without their next meal and it’s imperative that we make sure folks continue to receive the support they need to feed their families. https://t.co/5DcdNZtfFH

Our bipartisan #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act will ensure that folks have the resources they need to keep their families healthy and safe. In the wake of this pandemic we must do everything we can to support our citizens and businesses. https://t.co/h8vufLnScN

I commend the Senate for taking up our #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act bill and passing this vital legislation. Americans need expanded access to COVID-19 testing sick leave workers’ protections and food security programs as we fight to combat this pandemic. https://t.co/xvb8UhFuWP
The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act:  -Provides free COVID-19 testing. -Expands paid leave. -Bolsters food security initiatives. -Increases unemployment aid for America’s workers.

Americans deserve a clear and comprehensive plan outlining how the United States will combat the COVID-19 pandemic. I’m doing everything I can to keep folks safe beginning with supporting the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act.

Whether it’s passing vital legislation to confront national emergencies like the COVID-19 crisis or ensuring that hardworking families are able to keep their families strong and safe I will continue to focus every day on fighting for working people and putting Illinois first.

It is irresponsible and wrong to move forward with cuts to the social safety net let alone at a time when folks’ jobs are at risk due to the COVID-19 pandemic. I’ll hold this administration accountable and keep fighting to strengthen these vital programs. https://t.co/8s1XiAYYez

House Democrats passed the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act to combat the spread of COVID-19 and ensure the well-being of Americans during these trying times. Look folks protecting you and your family is my top priority -- I promise that we’ll get through this together. https://t.co/BHqsR7ImAG

Folks across America’s Heartland deserve a clear and comprehensive plan to combat the spread of COVID-19. We need to make sure we are taking care of Illinois families and I’ll keep fighting to ensure their well-being & financial security. #IL17 https://t.co/AXtkH1xqma

The #FamiliesFirst Act would extend paid sick leave & unemployment benefits while making coronavirus testing available for all. Democrats understand that COVID-19 does not discriminate based on background or circumstances -- neither should our health care solutions to combat it. https://t.co/fb8xv2nQeg

The #FamilyFirst Coronavirus Response Act includes free testing for anyone who needs it and an expansion of paid sick leave & unemployment benefits for those impacted. Protecting America’s families must remain a top priority. https://t.co/v46R7lp7oI

Our Democratic House Majority passed a funding package to ensure that coronavirus treatment will be affordable and widely available for Americans. I know full-well that our rural health clinics must have the resources needed to treat patients across the Heartland. https://t.co/doci2QiPI7
The Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2020 will help develop vaccines and support rural health clinics across the Heartland. https://t.co/tVgeJ3GBcB
Our Democratic House Majority appropriated $8.3 billion to combat the coronavirus because we know it’s imperative that health providers have all the tools necessary to care for our constituents.

The Trump administration must commit to making a coronavirus vaccine that’s affordable and widely available and ensure that local health providers have the tools they need to treat patients affected by this outbreak. https://t.co/54TNPzG4Cb
